Second, we need to educate. We need to hold workshops, seminars, and conferences. We need to bring together open-minded clinicians and researchers to discuss the potential of off-label prescribing.  We need to break down the stigma and fear surrounding it.

They push their patented drugs, regardless of efficacy, and demonize anything that threatens their profits. We need to expose this conflict of interest and advocate for patient-centered care, not profit-driven medicine.
